info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 9 at 2:37PM MST until October 9 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 237 PM MST /337 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain east of Page. Between 0.25 and 1.0 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly within the numerous slot canyons across the area.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... NMS Beach, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Lake Powell.
This includes the following slot canyons... Butterfly Canyon, Labyrinth Canyon, Face Canyon, West Canyon, Sand Canyon and Butterfly Canyon.
This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... West Canyon Creek, Last Chance Creek, Navajo Creek, Antelope Creek, Sand Wash and Kaibito Creek.
info.instruction:
Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
Get out of washes, creeks and slot canyon if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate creeks, slot canyons and washes.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST /545 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY
